sourceDesc.p: Converted from a Word document written by Nick D'Amore

list.item: convert those “,” things to just comma

body.p: “I see the track of a crow, the toes as usual less spread and the middle one making a more curved furrow in the snow than the partridge, as if they moved more unstably, revover their balance, –feeble on their feet. The inner toe a little the nearest to the middle one. This track goes to every hole but one or two out of a dozen, –directly from hole to hole, sometimes flying a little, —and also to an apple-core on the snow. I am pretty sure that this bird was after the bait which is usually dropped on the ice or in the hole.”
PE 10, pg. 129 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
